name: slug
content:
slug noun [C]
(CREATURE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
a small, usually black or brown creature with a long, soft body and no arms or legs, like a snail but with no shell
yio/ iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
mainly US informal a slow-moving, lazy person See also

slug noun [C]
(CREATURE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
a small animal with a soft body like a snail without a shell
If you say that someone is a slug, you mean that the person would rather do very little or nothing at all: I suppose you think I’m a slug for not helping.
slug noun [C]
(BULLET)
infml a bullet
slug noun [C]
(DRINK)
infml an amount of a drink that fills your mouth: She took a huge slug of very cold water.
slug noun [C]
(COIN)
a piece of metal used instead of a coin in a machine: The new toll machines will reject slugs.
slug verb [T]
(HIT)
to hit someone hard; punch: He made me so mad I wanted to slug him.
If you slug a baseball, you hit it very hard. Idiom
